paper_abstract: A graph G of order n (>= 2) is said to be panconnected if for each pair (x,y) of vertices of G there exists an xy-path of length l for each l such that d (G) (x,y)<= l <= n-1, where d (G) (x,y) denotes the length of a shortest xy-path in G. In this paper, we consider the panconnectivity of Cartesian product graphs. As a consequence of our results, we prove that the n-dimensional generalized hypercube Q (n) (k (1),k (2),aEuro broken vertical bar,k (n) ) is panconnected if and only if k (i) >= 3 (i=1,.....n), which generalizes a result of Hsieh et al. that the 3-ary n-cube Q(n)(3) is panconnected.
